Subject: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5...the Fuzor's Still Alive
Message-ID: <90bfl6+ml7b@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 642
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: wilddance_mare@...

Quickstrike:




The damage was heavy. Quickstrike's body worked over time to keep him 
alive, even for a few more minutes. He was a survivor, even if he 
didn't know it himself. His systems took over, shutting down, 
stopping the flow of mech fluid to save energy. His systems forced 
the fluid around his spark to stop cirulating. Portions of his brain 
shut down to reduce the risk in permant damage. And his spark slowed, 
slowing the pulse enough so it cannot be hear or detected. 

His body was set on beyond stasis lock, but on the border of death. 
His body kept him alive, just on what it could manage. On the 
outside, he was dead.
